00052 int main( int argc, char *argv[] )
00053 {
00054 
00055   try {
00056 
00057   std::vector< std::string > input;
00058   std::vector< std::string > output;
00059 
00060   float sx, sy, sz;
00061 
00062   const char *inputName = NULL;
00063   const char *outputName = NULL;
00064 
00065   // Parse arguments
00066 
00067   TCLAP::CmdLine cmd("Compute a low resolution image from a high resolution image by using a generative model", ' ', "Unversioned");
00068 
00069   TCLAP::ValueArg<std::string> inputArg("i","input","High resolution image",true,"","string",cmd);
00070   TCLAP::ValueArg<std::string> outputArg("o","output","Low resolution image",true,"","string",cmd);
00071 
00072   TCLAP::ValueArg<float> sxArg  ("","sx","Spacing in x-direction",false,1,"float",cmd);
00073   TCLAP::ValueArg<float> syArg  ("","sy","Spacing in y-direction",false,1,"float",cmd);
00074   TCLAP::ValueArg<float> szArg  ("","sz","Spacing in z-direction",false,1,"float",cmd);
00075 
00076   TCLAP::SwitchArg axlSwitch("","axl","Lower resolution in x", false);
00077   TCLAP::SwitchArg corSwitch("","cor","Lower resolution in y", false);
00078   TCLAP::SwitchArg sagSwitch("","sag","Lower resolution in z", false);
00079 
00080   std::vector<TCLAP::Arg*>  xorlist;
00081   xorlist.push_back(&axlSwitch);
00082   xorlist.push_back(&corSwitch);
00083   xorlist.push_back(&sagSwitch);
00084 
00085   cmd.xorAdd( xorlist );
00086 
00087   // Parse the argv array.
00088   cmd.parse( argc, argv );
00089 
00090   inputName  = inputArg.getValue().c_str();
00091   outputName = outputArg.getValue().c_str();
00092 
00093   sx = sxArg.getValue();
00094   sy = syArg.getValue();
00095   sz = szArg.getValue();
00096 
00097   bool axl = axlSwitch.getValue();
00098   bool cor = corSwitch.getValue();
00099   bool sag = sagSwitch.getValue();
00100 
00101 
00102   typedef short PixelType;
00103   const   unsigned int    Dimension = 3;
00104 
00105   typedef itk::Image< PixelType, Dimension >  ImageType;
00106 
00107   typedef itk::ImageFileReader< ImageType >   ImageReaderType;
00108   typedef itk::ImageFileWriter< ImageType >   WriterType;
00109 
00110 
00111   // Read reference image
00112 
00113   ImageReaderType::Pointer hrReader = ImageReaderType::New();
00114   hrReader -> SetFileName( inputName );
00115   hrReader -> Update();
00116 
00117   ImageType::Pointer hrImage = hrReader -> GetOutput();
00118 
00119 
00120   // Modify direction if necessary (cor or sag = true)
00121 
00122   vnl_matrix_fixed<double,3,3> vnlDirection  = hrImage -> GetDirection().GetVnlMatrix();
00123   vnl_matrix_fixed<double,3,3> vnlDirectionMod = hrImage -> GetDirection().GetVnlMatrix();
00124 
00125   if ( cor )
00126   {
00127     vnlDirectionMod.set_column(1,vnlDirection.get_column(2));
00128     vnlDirectionMod.set_column(2,vnlDirection.get_column(1));
00129   } else if ( sag )
00130     {
00131       vnlDirectionMod.set_column(0,vnlDirection.get_column(2));
00132       vnlDirectionMod.set_column(2,vnlDirection.get_column(0));
00133     }
00134 
00135   ImageType::DirectionType newDirection;
00136   newDirection = vnlDirectionMod;
00137 
00138 //  hrImage -> SetDirection ( newDirection );
00139 
00140 
00141   // Create low resolution image
00142 
00143   ImageType::SpacingType hrSpacing = hrImage -> GetSpacing();
00144   ImageType::SizeType    hrSize    = hrImage -> GetLargestPossibleRegion().GetSize();
00145 
00146   ImageType::SpacingType lrSpacing;
00147   lrSpacing[0] = sx; lrSpacing[1] = sy; lrSpacing[2] = sz;
00148 
00149   ImageType::Pointer lrImage = ImageType::New();
00150 
00151   ImageType::RegionType lrRegion;
00152 
00153   ImageType::IndexType  lrStart;
00154   lrStart[0] = 0; lrStart[1] = 0; lrStart[2] = 0;
00155 
00156   ImageType::SizeType   lrSize;
00157 
00158   if ( axl )
00159   {
00160     lrSize[0] = floor(hrSize[0] * hrSpacing[0] / lrSpacing[0]);
00161     lrSize[1] = floor(hrSize[1] * hrSpacing[1] / lrSpacing[1]);
00162     lrSize[2] = floor(hrSize[2] * hrSpacing[2] / lrSpacing[2]);
00163   } else if ( cor )
00164     {
00165       lrSize[0] = floor(hrSize[0] * hrSpacing[0] / lrSpacing[0]);
00166       lrSize[1] = floor(hrSize[2] * hrSpacing[2] / lrSpacing[1]);
00167       lrSize[2] = floor(hrSize[1] * hrSpacing[1] / lrSpacing[2]);
00168     } else if ( sag )
00169       {
00170         lrSize[0] = floor(hrSize[2] * hrSpacing[2] / lrSpacing[0]);
00171         lrSize[1] = floor(hrSize[1] * hrSpacing[1] / lrSpacing[1]);
00172         lrSize[2] = floor(hrSize[0] * hrSpacing[0] / lrSpacing[2]);
00173       }
00174 
00175   std::cout << "size high resolution = " << hrSize << std::endl;
00176   std::cout << "size low resolution = " << lrSize << std::endl;
00177 
00178 
00179   lrRegion.SetIndex( lrStart );
00180   lrRegion.SetSize(  lrSize );
00181 
00182   lrImage -> SetRegions( lrRegion );
00183   lrImage -> Allocate();
00184 
00185   std::cout << "lrSpacing = " << lrSpacing << std::endl;
00186   std::cout << "hrSpacing = " << hrSpacing << std::endl;
00187   std::cout << "lrSpacing + hrSpacing / 2 = " << (lrSpacing - hrSpacing)/ 2.0 << std::endl;
00188 
00189   lrImage -> SetSpacing( lrSpacing );
00190   lrImage -> SetDirection( newDirection );
00191   lrImage -> SetOrigin( hrImage -> GetOrigin() + (lrSpacing - hrSpacing)/ 2.0 );
00192 
00193 
00194   typedef btk::OrientedSpatialFunction<double, Dimension, ImageType::PointType> FunctionType;
00195   FunctionType::Pointer function = FunctionType::New();
00196   function -> SetDirection( lrImage -> GetDirection() );
00197   function -> SetSpacing(   lrImage -> GetSpacing() );
00198 
00199   typedef itk::ContinuousIndex<double, Dimension> ContinuousIndexType;
00200 
00201   std::vector<ContinuousIndexType> deltaIndexes;
00202   int npoints =  lrSpacing[2] / (2.0 * hrSpacing[2]) ;
00203   ContinuousIndexType delta;
00204   delta[0] = 0.0; delta[1] = 0.0;
00205 
00206   for (int i = -npoints ; i <= npoints; i++ )
00207   {
00208     delta[2] = i * 0.5 / (double) npoints;
00209     deltaIndexes.push_back(delta);
00210 
00211 //    std::cout << delta << std::endl;
00212   }
00213 
00214   typedef itk::LinearInterpolateImageFunction< ImageType, double> InterpolatorType;
00215   InterpolatorType::Pointer interpolator = InterpolatorType::New();
00216   interpolator -> SetInputImage( hrImage );
00217 
00218   typedef itk::ImageRegionIteratorWithIndex< ImageType > IteratorType;
00219   IteratorType lrIt( lrImage, lrImage -> GetLargestPossibleRegion() );
00220 
00221   ImageType::IndexType lrIndex;
00222   ImageType::PointType lrPoint;
00223   ContinuousIndexType  nbIndex;
00224   ImageType::PointType nbPoint;
00225 
00226   unsigned int counter;
00227   double value;
00228 
00229   for ( lrIt.GoToBegin(); ! lrIt.IsAtEnd(); ++lrIt)
00230   {
00231     lrIndex = lrIt.GetIndex();
00232     lrImage -> TransformIndexToPhysicalPoint( lrIndex, lrPoint );
00233     function -> SetCenter( lrPoint );
00234 
00235     counter = 0;
00236     value   = 0.0;
00237 
00238     for(unsigned int k=0; k<deltaIndexes.size(); k++)
00239     {
00240       nbIndex[0] = deltaIndexes[k][0] + lrIndex[0];
00241       nbIndex[1] = deltaIndexes[k][1] + lrIndex[1];
00242       nbIndex[2] = deltaIndexes[k][2] + lrIndex[2];
00243 
00244       lrImage -> TransformContinuousIndexToPhysicalPoint( nbIndex, nbPoint );
00245 
00246       if ( function -> Evaluate( nbPoint ) > 0)
00247       {
00248         // I assume an identity transform here ...
00249 
00250         if ( interpolator -> IsInsideBuffer( nbPoint ) )
00251         {
00252           value += interpolator -> Evaluate( nbPoint );
00253           counter++;
00254 
00255         }
00256 
00257       }
00258 
00259     }
00260 
00261     lrIt.Set(value / counter );
00262 //    lrIt.Set( 1 );
00263 
00264   }
00265 
00266 
00267   // Write image
00268 
00269   WriterType::Pointer writer =  WriterType::New();
00270   writer -> SetFileName( outputName );
00271   writer -> SetInput( lrImage );
00272 
00273   if ( strcmp(outputName,"") != 0)
00274   {
00275     std::cout << "Writing " << outputName << " ... ";
00276     writer -> Update();
00277     std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00278   }
00279 
00280   } catch (TCLAP::ArgException &e)  // catch any exceptions
00281   { std::cerr << "error: " << e.error() << " for arg " << e.argId() << std::endl; }
00282 
00283   return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00284 }
